raw.author: Ramamoorthy, Sujitha
raw.infacause: This issue occurs when the Jdbc URL is given incorrectly in the Amazon Redshift connection properties.
raw.infasolution:
​To resolve this issue, one has to give the correct JDBC URL in the Amazon Redshift connection properties​.
To find the JDBC URL that needs to be specified in the connection, follow the steps listed:




1. Login to Amazon RedShift console, in the Navigation pane, click Clusters.
2. Click the Cluster to get more information regarding the cluster.
3. Under Cluster database properties, one will be able to find the JDBC URL.

 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
 at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)

raw.author: Ramamoorthy, Sujitha
raw.infacause: This issue occurs when you have mapped body parameter before mapping header parameters.
raw.infasolution: ​To avoid such error ensure to map the header parameter first before mapping body parameters. If there are any changes made to the mapping, clear the mapping and remap starting with header parameter and later map the body fields.
raw.infaproblemdescription:
Following error is encountered when mapping fields to a webservice used at target transformation for a POST call. The field trying to be mapped is header parameter and not the body parameter.



"The parent of the group mapped to these elements is not the same as the parent of the group you want to map" ​

results.excerpt: REST V2 connector does not support security tags with in Swagger file. ... Try using header parameter for API keys and set username and password in the connection with Basic Authentication.

results.title: HOW TO: Abort the job when SQLCMD fails and is configured in Post or Pre-processing command section of Informatica Cloud Services
results.excerpt: In Informatica Cloud Services DTM will execute the Pre/Post session command or SQLCMD and checks the status of the command. ... Based on the status code DTM will decide upon successful or unsuccessful execution of the command. ... The status code will be successful for SQLCMD command even when the queries inside it ...

raw.title: HOW TO: Abort the job when SQLCMD fails and is configured in Post or Pre-processing command section of Informatica Cloud Services
raw.infakbtitle: HOW TO: Abort the job when SQLCMD fails and is configured in Post or Pre-processing command section of Informatica Cloud Services
raw.sysparents: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?><parents><parent name="KB" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/" /><parent name="HowTo" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/" /><parent name="6" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/6/" /><parent name="Pages" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/6/Pages" /><parent name="20" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/6/Pages/20" /></parents>
raw.author: Ramamoorthy, Sujitha
raw.infasolution:
In Informatica Cloud Services DTM will execute the Pre/Post session command or SQLCMD and checks the status of the command. Based on the status code DTM will decide upon successful or unsuccessful execution of the command. The status code will be successful for SQLCMD command even when the queries inside it failed unless SQLCMD is configured to Batch.
Example
If the SQLCMD is SQLCMD -S XXX -U USERNAME -P PASSWORD -Q "Insert into Persons(ID) values(25);" add -b to process in batch as


SQLCMD -S XXX -U USERNAME -P PASSWORD -b -Q "Insert into Persons(ID) values(25);"​
raw.infakeywords: SQLCMD; Post/Pre processing command; abort job upon failure; Informatcia Cloud services; kb522614
raw.infamoreinformation: ​In this instance ​even if you configure Advanced Session properties with "Pre-Post SQL Error" to "STOP", the job executes successfully as it is for Post-Pre SQL commands and not for Post or Pre-processing command.

raw.author: Ramamoorthy, Sujitha
raw.infacause: When one run the Informatica Cloud task using runAJobCli Utility ,One can get above mentioned warning message but task will get trigggered in the informatica cloud. This error message means runAJobCli package is corrupted.
raw.infasolution: To resolve this issue remove the  folder "package-runAJobCli.2" and checksum file "package-runAJobCli.2.checksum" from location "C:\Program Files\Informatica Cloud Secure Agent\downloads" and restart the secure agent. It will download the  fresh runAJobCli package from Informatica cloud .
raw.infaproblemdescription:
While running the task from runAJobCli utility on command prompt the following error message can be seen:


C:\Program Files\Informatica Cloud Secure Agent\apps\runAJobCli> set PATH=C:\Program Files\Informatica Cloud Secure Agent\jre\bin
C:\Program Files\Informatica Cloud Secure Agent\apps\runAJobCli> cli.bat runAJobCli -n KM_FF_TO_ORACLE_EMP -t DSS


log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (com.informatica.saas.utilities.plugins.RunAJobPlugin). 
log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly. 
log4j:WARN See http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#noconfig for more info.

results.title: FAQ: Are Japanese characters like Gaiji (Kanji) and Kana.supported with Informatica Cloud?
results.excerpt: Gaji and Kana characters can be processed with UTF-8 encoding. ... By default the agent runs in Unicode mode, hence all the data processing is possible with these characters. ... For connectors where encoding has to be specified in the connection, ensure to use UTF-8 to process these characters.
results.firstSentences: Gaji and Kana characters can be processed with UTF-8 encoding. By default the agent runs in Unicode mode, hence all the data processing is possible with these characters. For connectors where encoding has to be specified in the connection, ensure to use UTF-8 to process these characters. Cloud Data Integration

raw.author: M, Sudeep
raw.infakeywords: gaji; kanji; kana; unicode; japanese; characters; utf-8;ics

results.Title: FAQ: Are Japanese characters like Gaiji (Kanji) and Kana.supported with Informatica Cloud?
results.Excerpt: Gaji and Kana characters can be processed with UTF-8 encoding. ... By default the agent runs in Unicode mode, hence all the data processing is possible with these characters. ... For connectors where encoding has to be specified in the connection, ensure to use UTF-8 to process these characters.
results.FirstSentences: Gaji and Kana characters can be processed with UTF-8 encoding. By default the agent runs in Unicode mode, hence all the data processing is possible with these characters. For connectors where encoding has to be specified in the connection, ensure to use UTF-8 to process these characters. Cloud Data Integration

raw.author: Avinash, Ganta
raw.infacause:
By default, Informatica Cloud uses the DataDirect ODBC Driver for ICS Oracle connection.  


The ICS Oracle connection is based on ODBC specifications. The default date format in the ODBC specification is 'YYYY-MM-DD'. So if the input date is in any other format, the issue might be observed.
Note that Oracle's default date format is 'DD-MM-YYYY'.
raw.infasolution:
​Please be advised in order to process dates in a format other than 'YYYY-MM-DD', the ICS Oracle connector requires the date format be exclusively specified when using functions like to_date() or to_char(). In order to avoid discrepancies in processing dates, explicitly specify the format in all the date functions used in the query or view definition.

If explicitly specifying the date format is not feasible, one can make use of an ICS ODBC connection instead of using ICS Oracle connection.





The default date format can be set for the ODBC session by following these steps:
Windows Secure Agent:










1) Create an ODBC DSN in ODBC Data Source administrator, corresponding to the Oracle database server.
Choose the driver as 'DataDirect CLOSED 7.1 Oracle Wire Protocol for Informatica - R27'. Driver name can slightly vary, depending on the version.2) Along with the regular properties, specify the Initialization String in Advanced section of the ODBC Oracle Write Protocol driver setup, to specify the default date format for the database session:




alter session set NLS_DATE_FORMAT='DD-MON-YYYY'​





3) Create an ODBC connection type and specify the above DSN name.4) Modify the connection used in the task from the ICS Oracle connection to the ICS ODBC Connection.













Linux Secure Agent:




1) Create an ODBC DSN in the odbc.ini file, corresponding to the Oracle connection in the Agent installation.2) Along with the regular properties, add connection property:Initialization String=alter session set NLS_DATE_FORMAT='DD-MON-YYYY'3) Instead of using the default Oracle connection type, create an ODBC connection type and specify the above DSN name.4) Modify the connection used in the task from the Oracle connection to the ODBC Connection.This change with set the default date format for the database session to DD-MON-YYYY, and one can avoid explicitly specifying the date format in the to_date function.
raw.infaproblemdescription:
An ICS task that reads from Oracle fails when executing a query with to_date() function.





For e.g. select to_date (v_date) from table1 













This task succeeds when the field v_date contains a date value earlier than '31-DEC-2023'. 
For dates later than '1-JAN-2024' the task fails with the below mentioned error:












RR_4035 SQL Error [ FnName: Fetch Optimize -- [Informatica][ODBC Oracle Wire Protocol driver]Error in row. FnName: Fetch Optimize -- 

RR_4035 SQL Error [ FnName: Fetch -- [Informatica][ODBC Oracle Wire Protocol driver][Oracle]ORA-01858: a non-numeric character was found where a numeric was expected]. 







The task execution is successful if the date format is included in the to_date function. 
For e.g. select to_date (v_date, 'dd-mon-yyyy') from table1 













Note: The same query returns successful results when executed using Oracle client - SQL Developer.  





​
raw.infakeywords: Informatica Cloud; a non-numeric character was found where a numeric was expected; to date function; date format; nls date format; date values; date functions; ODBC driver; oracle connection
raw.infamoreinformation:
1) ​When the same task is executed with an ODBC connection based on Oracle's ODBC driver, the rows get processed successfully without specifying the date format in the to_ date function or setting an Initialization String.

2) Additional details regarding this error and cause are part of this link​ .

raw.title: HOW TO: Parameterize field mapping in Informatica Cloud Services?
raw.infakbtitle: HOW TO: Parameterize field mapping in Informatica Cloud Services?
raw.sysparents: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?><parents><parent name="KB" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/" /><parent name="HowTo" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/" /><parent name="6" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/6/" /><parent name="Pages" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/6/Pages" /><parent name="20" uri="https://kbcrawl.informatica.com/howto/6/Pages/20" /></parents>
raw.author: Dattatreya, Shweta
raw.infasolution:
​Follow the below steps to parameterize the mapping:
1.  Add an expression transformation
2. Rename
all the Incoming fields in Bulk either with a Prefix or Suffix. This ensures to
have same name as the Incoming fields during field mapping.
3. Add an expression of a dummy field and provide a
value. This can be used if there is a static field with same value
4. In the Expression tab of the expression
transformation click on “Allow additional fields and expressions during task
creation” and create a new parameter by giving a name. This helps to create/map
fields of your choice

5.  At target transformation add 2 rules

a.      
First to “Include All Fields”

b.      
Exclude “Fields by Text or Pattern”> Provide
the pattern you designed in the expression transformation either Fields or
Prefix or Fields of Suffix



This
setting helps to pull all fields excluding the fields with certain pattern.
6. Deploy the mapping to Mapping Configuration Task
7. At Mapping Configuration Task, on the “Input Parameters” tab of Mapping configuration Task one can find
Parameterized option to add fields with a drop-down symbol 

8. Add a new field by hovering on the drop down as
below


9.  Create the field type as Output field, provide
any name as per your use case, enter the datatype and precision if required.
Later configure the field by mapping the required field as below

10. Validate the mapping and run the job.



















​
raw.infakeywords: parameterize; field mapping; Mapping Configuration task;
